meanings.definition: The quality or state of being slimy.
meanings.sent1: The sliminess of the frog's skin helped it glide through the water effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't stand the sliminess of the algae-covered rocks by the pond.
meanings.sent3: The sliminess of the slime on the floor made it impossible to walk without slipping.
meanings.sent4: The sliminess of the mud after the rain made it challenging to navigate the trail.
meanings.sent5: The sliminess of the fish scales made them difficult to hold onto.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being unpleasantly smooth and slippery.
meanings.sent1: The sliminess of the oil spill made it hazardous for the birds in the area.
meanings.sent2: She recoiled at the sliminess of the raw oysters on her plate.
meanings.sent3: The sliminess of the banana peel on the sidewalk caused a comical slip.
meanings.sent4: The sliminess of the soap in the shower made it hard to grasp.
meanings.sent5: The sliminess of the eel's skin made it a challenge to catch.

meanings.definition: The feeling or appearance of being covered in a slimy substance.
meanings.sent1: The sliminess of the gooey slime on his hands made him cringe.
meanings.sent2: The sliminess of the mud on her shoes left a trail on the clean floor.
meanings.sent3: She joked about the sliminess of the slime making her hands feel like a snail.
meanings.sent4: The sliminess of the lotion made her skin feel hydrated and smooth.
meanings.sent5: The sliminess of the wet seaweed on the beach gave it a slippery texture.
